home.header: Create interactive posts to share on social media
home.subheader_partial: Start from a a template, remix it, and share. It's free and easyâ€”no coding required. Export your post everywhere
player.remix_disabled_message: The creator of this app has disabled remixing. Most apps on Koji are remixable, so continue browsing to find an app to remix, or visit the [Create Page](/create) to find ideas and inspiration.
player.remix_mobile_message:
You can remix games and apps on Koji from a tablet or desktop, you need a larger screen to use the editor right now.

If you open this app on a device with a larger screen and click Remix, you'll get your own copy of this app that you can modify and republish without having to know how to code! It's free!
player.render_errors: This app may have errors or other issues preventing it from loading.

search.info_box:
## Looking for a place to start?

All apps on Koji are created by remixing other apps. Visit the [Create Page](https://withkoji.com/create) to find some inspiration.

If you're a developer, find scaffolds, "blank" apps, and resources on the [Developer Page](https://withkoji.com/developer).

editor.collaboration.modal_header: Use the link below to share your Koji editor session with other people.
editor.collaboration.modal_body:
## How it works

When someone clicks the link, you will see a popup with their profile and be able to grant access or deny the request.

You aree in control of what people see. They will only be able to see and edit the file that you have open.

This link will allow people to request access to your project for the next 15 minutes.

editor.live_preview_settings.actions_des: Performing a hard reset DELETES everything in the Koji editor and re-downloads from your project's remote repository. If you have changes that you have not committed and pushed to your remote repository THEY WILL BE LOST.

editor.project_overview_description:
## **Welcome to your project**

If you haven't yet, check out the [Getting Started with Koji tutorial](http://bit.ly/StartWithKoji).

<iframe width="560" height="315" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/xMPvUkkcpac" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

There are always people around in our [Discord (live chat)](https://discordapp.com/invite/eQuMJF6) that are happy to help.
editor.quickstart_empty: This project does not include a quickstart. Get started customizing by choosing one of the customization sections from the menu.

editor.repository.remote_repository_desc: The location of the Git repository for this project. You must generate an Access Token in your Account Settings and use it in place of your password in order to clone from this URL.
editor.repository.upstream_repository_de: The location of the upstream Git repository for this project. This is the repository from which this project was cloned.

editor.database.database_overview:
# Koji Database

The Koji Database provides an easy to use Key-Value store for your projects.

Install the `@withkoji/database` package into your project's backend:

```
npm install --save @withkoji/database
```

Bring it into your route:
```
import Database from '@withkoji/database'


const database = new Database();
```

See available methods at https://github.com/madewithkoji/koji-database-sdk/blob/master/src/adapter/DatabaseAdapter.ts

More documentation coming soon!
editor.domains.which_service: Which service should serve traffic for this domain?
editor.domains.what_kind_of_domain: What kind of domain do you want to add?
editor.domains.koji_subdomain_descriptio: Each service in your app can have one subdomain on a Koji root domain, such as "awesomelist.withkoji.com" or "mygame.koji.game"
editor.domains.custom_domain_description: If you buy your own domain name, you can use it to serve your app
editor.domains.already_mapped: This service is already mapped to a Koji subdomain
editor.domains.configure_new_domain_desc: Configure a new custom domain for use with Koji. Once it's configured, you can use it to serve any of your apps.
editor.domains.configure_custom_domain:
## Point your domain to the Koji CDN

**Your project has been successful configured to start receiving traffic from your custom domain.**

To begin using your domain, you need to add the below DNS records. Once that's done, Koji will automatically take care of routing and HTTPS. The whole process can take up to an hour, so we'll send you an email when it's complete and your project is accessible.
editor.domains.configure_subdomain: ## Your project is receiving traffic at this domain.
editor.domains.certificate_info:
## Certificate information
Koji automatically manages HTTPS certificates for your domain. This includes procuring the certificate, serving the certificate, and renewing the certificate before it expires.
editor.domains.delete_confirm: Are you sure you want to delete this domain?
editor.domains.overview:
Point domains to your deployed project. Your frontend and backend can each have one custom withkoji.com domain. You can also configure domains you own to serve your projects.

#### Here is a [video tutorial](https://youtu.be/wuIExKzQ4zM) on how to configure a domain in Koji.
editor.plugins.plugins_overview:
With plugins, you can add code snippets to your app after it has been built, letting you do things like serve metadata and enable third-party services like analytics. 

#### Here is a [video tutorial](https://youtu.be/sANeQFUwD_0) on how to enable plugins for your project
editor.plugins.deactivate_confirm: Are you sure you want to deactivate this plugin?
editor.scheduled_jobs.overview: Use scheduled jobs to automatically invoke endpoints in your apps.
editor.scheduled_jobs.name: Name
editor.scheduled_jobs.no_jobs: This service does not have any scheduled jobs
editor.scheduled_jobs.frequency_descript: How often to run this job. Must be in the format of `RATE UNIT`, where `RATE` is a whole number, and UNIT` is one of `minutes`, `hours`, or `days`.
editor.scheduled_jobs.http_method_descri: The HTTP method to use when making the request
editor.scheduled_jobs.service_descriptio: The service in your app that should receive the request
editor.scheduled_jobs.path_description: The path in your service to invoke when the job runs
editor.scheduled_jobs.headers_descriptio: HTTP headers to send with the request
editor.scheduled_jobs.body_description: HTTP body to send with the request
editor.scheduled_jobs.delete_confirm: Are you sure you want to delete?
editor.versions.overview: New versions of your app are automatically built and deployed when you publish a new version from the Koji editor or push to master on your project's remote repository.
editor.versions.no_versions: This project has not been deployed yet
player.attributes.description: When you deploy an app, the Koji Profiler crawls it to better understand its performance, resource usage, and localization. This data is then used to help surface your app to its most relevant users.
player.attribute_bars.vcc: This app is a Visual Customization Control (VCC) designed to be used inside Koji templates. [Click here to learn more about VCCs](/developer)

payments.top_up_required_message: You need to top up your account balance in order to complete this transaction
payments.available_to_withdraw_details: Your balance available for withdrawl consists of payments you have received from other Koji users. Balance top-ups from credit cards or gift cards are not available for withdrawl. You must be enrolled in the Koji Partner Program to transfer funds to your debit card or bank account.
payments.partner_program_details: Payments you receive from other Koji users can be transferred to your bank account or debit card using Stripe. Enroll using the link above to begin receiving payments. If your country is not supported by Stripe, please email us at contact@gometa.io
